subject: Re: [junit] Seeking sample JUnit result file with Categories
msgSnippet: Todd, I m afraid I can t.  There s no special support in ant that I m aware of for categories, so I d be surprised if the XML output looked significantly
messageBody:
Todd,

I'm afraid I can't. There's no special support in ant that I'm aware
of for categories, so I'd be surprised if the XML output looked
significantly different.

David Sff

On Mon, Apr 19, 2010 at 8:48 PM, ttopwells <ttopwells@...> wrote:
> I have a tool that's parsing various test file formats, and it'd be great if somebody would be willing to send me a copy of a JUnit XML result that uses Categories. I'd rather not have to cook up a whole JUnit project myself just for the purposes of seeing what the format looks like.
>
> Can someone help me out?
>
> Thanks,
>
> -Todd
